channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The global empathy crisis that confronts us this Christmas
item.description: Empathy levels diminished 14% across the U.S. after the pandemic, with the steepest drop among millennials, according to a United Way survey.

item.title: 5 of the hottest jobs in 2025
item.description: In 2025, AI became officially unavoidable: It had been lurking in the background before, as early adapters experimented with it. But this year, compan...

item.title: California farming mogul in bitter divorce proceedings arrested on suspicion of murdering his wife
item.description: Michael Abatti has grown onions, broccoli and cantaloupes and served on the board of the powerful Imperial Irrigation District from 2006 to 2010.

item.title: Telluride resort owner rips into ski patrol union after strikes shuts down slopes on Christmas
item.description: The Telluride Professional Ski Patrol Association voted to strike Saturday after contract negotiations since June failed to yield an agreement on pay.

item.title: Drummer cancels Christmas Eve ‘Jazz Jams’ at Kennedy Center after name change, ending 20-year tradition
item.description: “When I saw the name change on the Kennedy Center website and then hours later on the building, I chose to cancel our concert,” Chuck Redd told the AP...

item.title: Goldman Sachs expects layoffs to keep rising—and says investors are punishing the stocks of companies that slash staff
item.description: Analysts ran the numbers and found a surprising change in how investors are reacting to layoff announcements.

item.title: Top 12 productivity books of 2025 to change your relationship with work and time
item.description: Somewhere between endless meetings and half-finished projects, we all went looking for better ways to get things done this year. These are the 2025 ti...

item.title: 5 surprising ways to use AI
item.description: This article is republished with permission from Wonder Tools , a newsletter that helps you discover the most useful sites and apps. I like pushing AI...

item.title: Here’s why visiting museums between Christmas and New Year’s makes me a better leader
item.description: My working days often unfold in either Zoom minimalist workplaces or glass-walled conference rooms with sleek windows, filled with entrepreneurs pitch...

item.title: The Shocking Heist That Cost Glimmr $1 Million in Merchandise
item.description: The hair care company fell prey to a sophisticated cargo heist. Here’s how the thieves did it and what your company needs to watch out for.

item.title: Avoid the After-Click Abyss
item.description: Marketers spend millions perfecting targeting and creative, but then lose the customer.

item.title: From Fear to Curiosity: How Great Leaders Reframe Innovation
The Real Reason Your Meetings Go Off the Rails
item.description: Forget active listening. The new science of listening explains why smart leaders clash and how to fix decision paralysis.

item.title: 2026 Will Punish Lazy Email Marketing
item.description: Here’s how to keep your email strategy working.

item.title: Why brands need to stop treating sound as a backing track
item.description: The biggest brands pour creativity into being instantly recognizable. A logo you can spot at 20 paces. A color palette that becomes cultural shorthand...
